lines.content: ### A new intelligent chatbot for all your scheduling needs!
Shows a list of all tasks, their completeness status, and any dates/times attached to them.
Adds a todo to the list of tasks.
Adds a deadline to the list of tasks.
Adds a event to the list of tasks.
If an task is marked, unmark it. Otherwise, mark it.
- A task's index can be found using `list`.
- If an index that doesn't exist in the list is inputted, the program throws an error.
Deletes a task from the list of tasks.
- A task's index can be found using `list`.
- If an index that doesn't exist in the list is inputted, the program throws an error.
## Searching for a task by name: `find`
Lists all tasks with matching names to user-inputted keywords.
- `find` is not sensitive for case. For instance, `homeWork` will match `Homework`.
- The order of the keywords doesn't matter. For instance, `homework math` is the same as `math homework`.
- Only the name of the tasks is searched.
Exits out of the program and gives a farewell message.
Gertrude saves automatically to the user's hard drive after each input. No manual saving is necessary.

* Manages saving and loading task list data to and from a text file.

* Data is formatted on each line as SYMBOL | DONE | NAME | TIME1 | TIME2
* @throws GertrudeException if the save file isn't found
* @throws CorruptedFileException if the save file doesn't have the correct format

* The framework for all objects contained in the task list.
* Contains methods for initialization, printing, and marking.
* name (String): The user-inputted name/descriptor for the task
* isDone (boolean): Contains whether the task is done yet.
* symbol (String): The symbol associated with each task. Used while printing.
* Note that tasks are always not done when initialized.
* @param name the name/descriptor of the task
* Note that tasks are always not done when initialized.
* Overrides toString in order to create a descriptor for the task object.
* Contains the task's symbol, whether it's done (marked with an X), and its name.
* @return the String to print when printing the task object.
* If the task is done, marks as not done. Otherwise, mark as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
